posts.post_content:
This is part three of what I will dub a 'linear cycle'; a card in each set of a block that is connected to each other.  
  
This together with [Premature Burial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Premature Burial), and [Cradle to the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cradle to the Grave).
posts.html:
This is part three of what I will dub a 'linear cycle'; a card in each set of a block that is connected to each other.

This together with Premature Burial, and Cradle to the Grave.

Posted By: TDL (10/7/2010 9:54:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It does destroy creatures with protection from black and shroud. It also has no drawbacks to be played early in a mono black deck, you trade surprise for mana (because you can pay for it before the creature comes into play) its biggest flaw is you can't choose which creature to kill, they do.  
  
Of course that can make a pretty good deterrent too, if you play it turn 4 or 5 and they have a good mana curve you can make them waste a turn by making them waste playing a creature on this, or they wait for a cheaper one.
posts.html:
It does destroy creatures with protection from black and shroud. It also has no drawbacks to be played early in a mono black deck, you trade surprise for mana (because you can pay for it before the creature comes into play) its biggest flaw is you can't choose which creature to kill, they do.

Of course that can make a pretty good deterrent too, if you play it turn 4 or 5 and they have a good mana curve you can make them waste a turn by making them waste playing a creature on this, or they wait for a cheaper one.

Posted By: lorendorky (6/17/2011 10:32:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I've been very pleasantly surprised by this card. I started running it in a mono-black commander deck purely because I was short of relevant on-color cards - and it's remarkably effective in casual multiplayer. In a duel, players will generally throw a cheap creature at it straight away to pop it, but in multiplayer it quite often buys me a full 2-3 rounds in which nobody plays any creatures because they're waiting for someone else to break it.
posts.html:
